main event: Multiple UFO sightings reported in various locations in the United States in 1952, including Bismarck, North Dakota and Minot Air Force Base. The sightings involved oval-shaped, luminous, and noiseless objects performing incredible maneuvers at high speeds.
interesting points: The objects were observed by multiple witnesses, including civilian women, pilots, and experienced airplane spotters during World War II.

The objects were described as being silent, round or oval-shaped, and luminous with no visible means of propulsion. They exhibited erratic movements and incredible speeds far surpassing known aircraft capabilities.
An Air Force jet interceptor was scrambled to intercept the objects in one incident, but the objects disappeared before any contact could be made.
One observation described the objects as being 11 miles from Minot Air Force Base, emphasizing the proximity to a military installation.
The sightings took place over a period of several months, indicating a series of unexplained aerial phenomena occurring in the United States during that time.
location: Bismarck, North Dakota and Minot Air Force Base
witnesses: civilian women, experienced airplane spotters, pilots, and military personnel
